newsitem.title: PERU: Peru posts 4.5 percent Jan year-on-year GDP growth.
newsitem.headline: Peru posts 4.5 percent Jan year-on-year GDP growth.

text.p: The Peruvian economy grew 4.5 percent year-on-year in January, compared with a contraction of 2.2 percent in January 1996, President Alberto Fujimori said Monday.
"With growth in January of 4.5 percent, the (year-on-year) growth of Gross Domestic Product in the last three months is an average of six percent," he said in a radio interview.
Fujimori added that Peru is now "assured a growth of between four and five percent" in 1997. Peru's GDP rose 2.8 percent in 1996 versus 7.0 percent the previous year.
